Anaheim, California

Anaheim is one of the most populated cities in California located towards the center of Orange County in the southern half of California.

Anaheim Was Named By Ethnic Bavarian From San Francisco

Who named Anaheim exactly? The story of how Anaheim was named starts with a group of 50 families from the German state of Bavaria who where in search of a plot of land in order to start growing and harvesting grapes. The Bavarian state in Germany is known for their strong catholic ties and their traditional clothing (lederhosen) which are famously worn during their annual drinking festival, Oktoberfest.

Who Was Here Before The Germans

Before the 50 families from Germany migrated from Northern California the plot of land known as Anaheim was part of a ranch that belonged to.

Before Europeans

Before any white people arrived lol Anaheim was inhabited by the Tongva people. The Tongva people where semi nomadic meaning that while they did have settlements they would also constantly move around in order to find food and other resources.

An American Staple "Disneyland"

Above all else Anaheim is home to Mickey Mouse.

Disneyland is a theme park that sits on about 500 acres of land in the heart of Anaheim, California. Disneyland see an average of 27,250,000 people of year from all over the world making it one of the most visited places on earth. For comparison the famous
